issue.title: 0.6.2 (at least) brings powerful machine to its knees while downloading transaction updates

events.body: Note atime and compression are both disabled on this ZFS dataset.
If you want to keep a powerful machine powerful, do not use a userspace filesystem. (I assume thats how you're using ZFS on Fedora 17, because it certainly isn't part of Fedora)

Who told you that I was using an userspace filesystem?

I am not:

~@karen.dragonfear Î±:
lsmod | egrep '(spl|zfs)'
zfs                  1040731  31 
zunicode              330756  1 zfs
zavl                   14383  1 zfs
zcommon                43419  1 zfs
znvpair                47218  2 zcommon,zfs
spl                   157548  5 znvpair,zcommon,zavl,zunicode,zfs
zlib_deflate           26614  1 spl
With 0.6.2 sure ^^, with current versions it should be much smoother...

Current versions are buttery smooth. I checked with the old machine. The new machine does 20GB/s from RAM to CPU and 320 MB/s from the SSD, so I have no problem anymore.

 But the more optimized the better. Bitcoin should not be a expensive computer boys' club.
@Rudd-O If this is no longer an issue feel free to close it.
